verses.verse: Fear (Ex. 15:15) took hold of them there, And pain, as of a woman in birth pangs,
As when You break the (1 Kin. 10:22; Ezek. 27:25) ships of Tarshish With an east wind.
As we have heard, So we have seen In the city of the LORD of hosts, In the city of our God: God will ((Ps. 87:5; Is. 2:2); Mic. 4:1) establish it forever. Selah
We have thought, O God, on (Ps. 26:3) Your lovingkindness, In the midst of Your temple.
According to ((Deut. 28:58); Josh. 7:9; Mal. 1:11) Your name, O God, So is Your praise to the ends of the earth; Your right hand is full of righteousness.
Let Mount Zion rejoice, Let the daughters of Judah be glad, Because of Your judgments.
Walk about Zion, And go all around her. Count her towers;
Mark well her bulwarks; Consider her palaces; That you may ((Ps. 78:5-7)) tell it to the generation following.
For this is God, Our God forever and ever; (Is. 58:11) He will be our guide Even to death.
The Confidence of the Foolish To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. [1] Hear this, all peoples; Give ear, all inhabitants of the world,
Both low and high, Rich and poor together.
My mouth shall speak wisdom, And the meditation of my heart shall give understanding.
I will incline my ear to a proverb; I will disclose my dark saying on the harp.
Why should I fear in the days of evil, When the iniquity at my heels surrounds me?
Those who (Job 31:24; Ps. 52:7; (Prov. 11:28; Mark 10:23, 24)) trust in their wealth And boast in the multitude of their riches,
None of them can by any means redeem his brother, Nor (Job 36:18, 19) give to God a ransom for him—
For ((Matt. 16:26)) the redemption of their souls is costly, And it shall cease forever—
That he should continue to live eternally, And (Ps. 89:48) not see the Pit.
For he sees wise men die; Likewise the fool and the senseless person perish, And leave their wealth to others.
Their inner thought is that their houses will last forever, Their dwelling places to all generations; They (Gen. 4:17; Deut. 3:14) call their lands after their own names.
